$comment: This is based on https://github.com/flywheel-io/gears/blob/master/spec/manifest.schema.json. It is NOT used for validation, just for doc/code gen.

_88gear-doc.description: A full gear description, including manifest and exchange information

$eref.description: Gear manifest
The gear category
Metadata object that describes the origin of a gear version

___git-commit.description: The SHA-1 hash referring to the git commit

___rootfs-url.description: The absolute URL of the gear's root file system

___rootfs-hash.description: The cryptographic hash of the root filesystem in the form of "algorithm:<base16 hash>"

_88gear-description.description: A brief description of the gear's purpose. Ideally 1-4 sentences.

_88gear-custom.description: A place for gear authors to put arbitrary information.

_88gear-inputs.description: Schema snippets describing the inputs this gear consumes.

$eref.description: Describes a gear input

___optional.description: Allow the gear to mark an input file as optional.

___description.description: Hackaround for description not technically being a schema directive

_88gear-label.description: The human-friendly name of this gear.

$eref.description: A schema directive.

___optional.description: Allow the gear to mark an input file as optional.

___description.description: Hackaround for description not technically being a schema directive

_88gear-cite.description: (optional) Any citations relevant to the algorithm(s) or work present in the gear.

$eref.description: A valid URI, or empty string.

_88gear-url.description: The URL where more information about this gear can be found. Leave blank if none.

$eref.description: (optional) Any citations relevant to the algorithm(s) or work present in the gear.
Software license of the gear
Schema snippets describing the options this gear consumes. Not currently processed.
A place for gear authors to put arbitrary information.
Environment variables that should be set for the gear.
The human-friendly name of this gear.
The URL where the source code of this gear can be found. Leave blank if none.
The identification of this gear.
A brief description of the gear's purpose. Ideally 1-4 sentences.
A human-friendly string explaining the release version of this gear. Example: 3.2.1
The URL where more information about this gear can be found. Leave blank if none.
(optional) The maintainer of this gear. Can be used to distinguish the algorithm author from the gear maintainer.
If provided, the starting command for the gear, rather than /flywheel/v0/run. Will be templated according to the spec.
The author of this gear.
Schema snippets describing the inputs this gear consumes.

_88gear-exchange.description: Metadata object that describes the origin of a gear version

___git-commit.description: The SHA-1 hash referring to the git commit

___rootfs-url.description: The absolute URL of the gear's root file system

___rootfs-hash.description: The cryptographic hash of the root filesystem in the form of "algorithm:<base16 hash>"

_88gear-maintainer.description: (optional) The maintainer of this gear. Can be used to distinguish the algorithm author from the gear maintainer.

_88gear-uri.description: A valid URI, or empty string.

$eref.description: A valid URI, or empty string.

_88gear-source.description: The URL where the source code of this gear can be found. Leave blank if none.

_88gear-command.description: If provided, the starting command for the gear, rather than /flywheel/v0/run. Will be templated according to the spec.

_88gear-version.description: A human-friendly string explaining the release version of this gear. Example: 3.2.1

_88gear-config.description: Schema snippets describing the options this gear consumes. Not currently processed.

$eref.description: A schema directive.

_88gear-environment.description: Environment variables that should be set for the gear.
